item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

Or…mopar could just start taking action on all the noobs that don’t read the title, make it where they can’t see the board until they read the stickies that way, if they do something against the rules, he has every right to temp ban/disallow access for a little bit.

item.title: New Client Hacking Board Section
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

[quote=“NOURLOL, post:8, topic:7977”]As I posted above, it’s fucking pointless.
People are posting in the wrong forums without reading the goddamned forum title.

I propose:

[ul][li]You move private servers to another site entirely.[/li]
[li]You move MoparScape to another site entirely.[/li][/ul]

I could not give less of a shit if this kills 90% of your userbase, you can always crosslink across forums.
People who sign up to see private servers are not going to care about the community, nor respecting the rules. They deserve to be somewhere where they can all hype and spam together.

What contributed to killing Kaitnieks.com? Private servers, private server clients …

And then, only after you have done this, can you organise your board and expect people to follow it.

This also should help your problems with JageX.[/quote]

Read full topic

People are posting in the wrong forums without reading the goddamned forum title.

People who sign up to see private servers are not going to care about the community, nor respecting the rules. They deserve to be somewhere where they can all hype and spam together.

And then, only after you have done this, can you organise your board and expect people to follow it.

This also should help your problems with JageX.

item.title: New Client Hacking Board Section
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“sdouble, post:3, topic:7977”]About client hacking sections, I said it before. What we need is a separate section for the private server clients. It’s incredibly annoying to think there may have been something useful posted in there because it has a new post icon, then you find out it’s for private server clients. Old news, live in the now. There should be a section for client hacking inside of the private servers forum so the rs2 doesn’t get flooded with garbage. Maybe someone that wants some I’m a spamming noob that didn’t read the rules, they could just create a thread in there and link to tutorials. Keep it up to date, I’m sure some admin/mod would sticky it if requested.

I’m more interesting in making people post threads IN THE CORRECT FUCKING FORUMS, before any structure can be of use.

That would be nice, and these MOVED placeholders are terribly annoying as well. That is one thing Kaitnieks absolutely did not want to see on his forum. It looks like ass and it’s even worse on smf. At least on vbulletin, you click on it once and it would just take you there. smf makes you click on it to see that it’s moved, then click another link inside resulting in horrible functionality and wasted bandwidth.[/quote]

That is an excellent idea sdouble, the private server client section, I will add that in right away and start moving topics

and about the moved placeholders, yes they are annoying, but I can remove them all with one click, I do it every once in a while

Read full topic

item.title: New Client Hacking Board Section
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

About client hacking sections, I said it before. What we need is a separate section for the private server clients. It’s incredibly annoying to think there may have been something useful posted in there because it has a new post icon, then you find out it’s for private server clients. Old news, live in the now. There should be a section for client hacking inside of the private servers forum so the rs2 doesn’t get flooded with garbage. Maybe someone that wants some I’m a spamming noob that didn’t read the rules, they could just create a thread in there and link to tutorials. Keep it up to date, I’m sure some admin/mod would sticky it if requested.

NOURLOL:

I’m more interesting in making people post threads IN THE CORRECT FUCKING FORUMS, before any structure can be of use.

That would be nice, and these MOVED placeholders are terribly annoying as well. That is one thing Kaitnieks absolutely did not want to see on his forum. It looks like ass and it’s even worse on smf. At least on vbulletin, you click on it once and it would just take you there. smf makes you click on it to see that it’s moved, then click another link inside resulting in horrible functionality and wasted bandwidth.
